com.rivieracode.realm

Interface RealmDelegate


  • public interface RealmDelegate
    The Local EJB implements this interface to process authentication and authorization. Add the JAR has dependency or copy the file to the project.
    Author:
    Jean-Michel Tanguy

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Principal authenticate(Properties properties, String username, String password)
      Performs custom authentication (DB, LDAP, File, ...).
      Enumeration getGroupNames(Properties properties, String username)
      Provides the groups for the user as configured in the web.xml of the client project.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        Principal authenticate(Properties properties,
                       String username,
                       String password)
                throws LoginException
        Performs custom authentication (DB, LDAP, File, ...).

        Custom Principal can be returned and added to the Subject in order to pass additional information or configuration to the client application. Subject is then retrieved and processed as follow : 

         Subject subject = (Subject) PolicyContext.getContext("javax.security.auth.Subject.container");
   Set<MyCustomPrincipal> principals = subject.getPrincipals(MyCustomPrincipal.class);
   for (MyCustomPrincipal principal : principals) {
       // do necessary tasks
   }
        Parameters:
        properties - passing realm properties from container configuration
        username - container managed username
        password - container managed password
        Returns:
        a custom Principal to be added to the Subject (or null)
        Throws:
        LoginException - any exception should be return as a LoginException to prevent insights to credential context

      • getGroupNames

        Enumeration getGroupNames(Properties properties,
                          String username)
                   throws com.sun.enterprise.security.auth.realm.InvalidOperationException,
                          com.sun.enterprise.security.auth.realm.NoSuchUserException
        Provides the groups for the user as configured in the web.xml of the client project.
        Parameters:
        properties - passing realm properties from the container configuration
        username - container managed username
        Returns:
        groups List of groups (or roles) for the username
        Throws:
        com.sun.enterprise.security.auth.realm.InvalidOperationException - if any error
        com.sun.enterprise.security.auth.realm.NoSuchUserException - User is not accepted
